event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Online any CPU that was automatically offlined in response to this fault (use fmdump -v -u <EVENT_ID> to identify the CPU). The fault should also be repaired with fmadm repair <EVENT_ID>. This misdiagnosis bug is being fixed - patch numbers for Solaris 10 will appear here when aavailable.\n
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: (This is a misdiagnosis of a potential main memory (DIMM) fault as a CPU cache fault. Ignore this fault and look for memory errors and faults from the DIMMS associated with this CPU.)
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item: This is a misdiagnosis resulting from attributing certain errors reported by per-core caches to those caches rather than to their real source which is ECC errors from DIMMs associated with this CPU. If a DIMM is indeed faulty then other ECC error telemetry detected at the NorthBridge will correctly diagnose a DIMM error (it may just take a little longer since a fraction of the telemetry arising from the fault is being misdiagnosed).
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Performance of this system may be affected.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: A cpu has likely been offlined in response to this misdiagnosis.
event_registry_properties.name: severity
title
